DataElement.preferredName: Hospital Specific Hormone Therapy Hormone Therapy Number Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Records whether systemic hormonal agents were administered as first-course treatment at this facility or the reason they were not given.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Records whether systemic hormonal agents were administered as first-course treatment at this facility or the reason they were not given.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.:Specified; clearly and explicitly stated.

Concepts.definition: An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.

Property.preferredDefinition: Various treatment modalities that produce the desired therapeutic effect by means of change of hormone/hormones level. The treatment may include administration of hormones or hormone analogs to the patient, or decreasing the level of hormones in the body by using hormone antagonists, or hormone ablation therapy. The concept covers but not limited to: intermittent or permanent hormone suppression or ablation in treatment of hormone-dependent tumors, hormone replacement therapy of any kind, hormonal component of gender reassignment therapy, hormonal contraception, surgical and radiation castration.

Concepts.definition: Various treatment modalities that produce the desired therapeutic effect by means of change of hormone/hormones level.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A category of organic or inorganic substances, elements, and isotopes used in research or for the prevention, diagnosis, and/or treatment of disease states. Includes biologically active substances that are either synthetically manufactured or endogenous substances extracted and processed to be reintroduced into an organism. Chemicals and drugs also include hazardous substances, and naturally occurring or synthetically produced substances required to maintain life.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Chemical substances having a specific regulatory effect on the activity of a certain organ or organs. The term was originally applied to substances secreted by various endocrine glands and transported in the bloodstream to the target organs. It is sometimes extended to include those substances that are not produced by the endocrine glands but that have similar effects._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process._Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: It is unknown whether a hormonal agent(s) was recommended or administered because it is not stated in the patient record; death certificate-only cases.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: It is unknown whether a hormonal agent(s) was recommended or administered because it is not stated in the patient record; death certificate-only cases.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: It is unknown whether a hormonal agent(s) was recommended or administered because it is not stated in the patient record; death certificate-only cases.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hormone therapy was recommended, but it is unknown if it was administered.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hormone therapy was recommended, but it is unknown if it was administered.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hormone therapy was recommended, but it is unknown if it was administered.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hormone therapy was not administered. It was recommended by the patient's physician, but this treatment was refused by the patient, the patient's family member, or the patient's guardian. The refusal was noted in the patient record.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hormone therapy was not administered. It was recommended by the patient's physician, but this treatment was refused by the patient, the patient's family member, or the patient's guardian. The refusal was noted in the patient record.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hormone therapy was not administered. It was recommended by the patient's physician, but this treatment was refused by the patient, the patient's family member, or the patient's guardian. The refusal was noted in the patient record.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hormone therapy was not administered. It was recommended by the patient's physician, but was not administered as part of first-course therapy. No reason was stated in the patient record.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hormone therapy was not administered. It was recommended by the patient's physician, but was not administered as part of first-course therapy. No reason was stated in the patient record.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hormone therapy was not administered. It was recommended by the patient's physician, but was not administered as part of first-course therapy. No reason was stated in the patient record.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hormone therapy was not administered because the patient died prior to planned or recommended therapy.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hormone therapy was not administered because the patient died prior to planned or recommended therapy.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hormone therapy was not administered because the patient died prior to planned or recommended therapy.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: None, hormone therapy was not part of the planned first course of therapy. Diagnosed at autopsy.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: None, hormone therapy was not part of the planned first course of therapy. Diagnosed at autopsy.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: None, hormone therapy was not part of the planned first course of therapy. Diagnosed at autopsy.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hormone therapy administered as first course therapy.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hormone therapy administered as first course therapy.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hormone therapy administered as first course therapy.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hormone therapy was not recommended/administered because it was contraindicated due to patient risk factors (comorbid conditions, advanced age), or there was progression of disease prior to administration.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hormone therapy was not recommended/administered because it was contraindicated due to patient risk factors (comorbid conditions, advanced age), or there was progression of disease prior to administration.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hormone therapy was not recommended/administered because it was contraindicated due to patient risk factors (comorbid conditions, advanced age), or there was progression of disease prior to administration.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual entities required by NCI operations and systems. Includes administrative, financial, organizational and quasi-scientific concepts required for NCI operations and systems.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Chemical substances having a specific regulatory effect on the activity of a certain organ or organs. The term was originally applied to substances secreted by various endocrine glands and transported in the bloodstream to the target organs. It is sometimes extended to include those substances that are not produced by the endocrine glands but that have similar effects.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Chemical substances having a specific regulatory effect on the activity of a certain organ or organs. The term was originally applied to substances secreted by various endocrine glands and transported in the bloodstream to the target organs. It is sometimes extended to include those substances that are not produced by the endocrine glands but that have similar effects.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences

ReferenceDocuments.name: RX Hosp--Hormone Description
ReferenceDocuments.description: Hormone therapy consists of a group of drugs that may affect the long-term control of a cancer's growth. It is not usually used as a curative measure.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Records whether systemic hormonal agents were administered as first-course treatment at this facility or the reason they were not given.
